articleContent.title: Chord: 13th in A# (Shape: C)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: 13th in A# (Shape: C)

## Brief Presentation
The 13th chord is a rich and colorful chord that adds layers of complexity to a musical arrangement. In the key of A# (or Bb), when played using the C shape on the guitar, the 13th chord offers a lush and jazzy sound that can be used to create a sophisticated and harmonically interesting atmosphere in music.

## Notes and Intervals
The A# 13th chord in the C shape consists of the following notes and their respective intervals:
- A# (Root)
- E (5th)
- G# (7th)
- C (3rd)
- F (13th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The A# 13th chord in the C shape is often used in jazz, R&B, and funk music genres. It provides a smooth and soulful flavor to compositions, adding warmth and depth to the overall sound. The jazzy quality of the 13th chord brings a sense of sophistication and elegance to any musical piece.

## Songs
Here are three songs that use the A# 13th chord in the C shape:
1. "**Autumn Leaves**" - This jazz standard features the A# 13th chord in the C shape in various sections, contributing to the harmonic richness of the piece.
2. "**I Wish**" by Stevie Wonder - The funky and groovy vibe of this song is enhanced by the A# 13th chord in the C shape, adding a cool and jazzy element to the chord progression.
3. "**Fly Me to the Moon**" - This popular jazz tune utilizes the A# 13th chord in the C shape to create a dreamy and romantic atmosphere, showcasing the versatility of this chord in a classic jazz setting.

By incorporating the A# 13th chord in the C shape into your musical repertoire, you can explore new harmonic possibilities and infuse your compositions with a touch of sophistication and flair.
